title: Coastal Cruisin’: Ripton & Co’s All-Denim Road Trip Up the California Coast
content:
Step one: buy a 1986 Honda Accord just north of the Mexican border. Step two? Well, Ripton & Co then welded up a hitch, added a bike rack and set off to log 1000 miles of all-denim adventure up the California Coast.

Boulder, Colorado’s Ripton & Co., makers of technical jorts and overalls say they’ve always been inspired by California, with their “imagination of the wild West Coast and its intersection with the Ripton ethos was obvious“.

So, they hopped in “Sweet Love” and drove up the coast of California to ride bikes with cool people in hopes to uncover the “wild, unknown, and unrefined side of California”.

Below are a few examples of their goods:

Women’s Walden Jorts

The Women’s Diesel Jorts are built with featherweight performance-stretch denim. These jorts are only available in the “cut-off” flavor.

Features

  • Blacker than the ink of a giant squid
  • Gusseted for smooth sailing below the equator
  • 54% stretch
  • 9.5 oz. denim
  • 72.5% cotton, 3.5% elastane, 13% recycled cotton, 11% recycled polyester
  • 5.5″ inseam

Retail: $65

Sizes: 24 through 36

Men’s Diesel Overalls

The men’s Diesel Overalls are built with ample stretch and a brushed-back interior. They are built from Sorbtek performance denim and have unique moisture-wicking and temperature-regulating properties.

Features

  • 20% weft stretch
  • 12.5 ounces
  • 66% cotton, 32.5% Repreve Sorbtek® Polyester, 1.5% Spandex
  • Sorbtek® is made from recycled plastic bottles and wicks moisture 3 times faster
  • 2 Sunglass/pen/flip blade openings
  • Zippered chest pocket
  • Deeper hand pockets

Retail: $149

Sizes: Small through XXL
